content:
• Tuesday, February 28, 2012
  • TRTN

    TAL International Group (NYSE:TAL) announces a 3M shares secondary offering. Shares -2.4% AH.

    TAL International Group (NYSE:TAL) announces a 3M shares secondary offering. Shares -2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 PM
  • FOE

    More on Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q4 misses both EPS and revenue estimates. Revenue declined 17% Y/Y, as...

    More on Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q4 misses both EPS and revenue estimates. Revenue declined 17% Y/Y, as demand for conductive pastes used in solar cells declined, resulting in significant booking reductions by its customers. The company also lowers FY12 guidance, now expecting its EPS to be $0.40 - $0.65, below the Street view of $0.68. Shares -1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM
  • FOE

    Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q4 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $442.6M (-17.6% Y/Y). Shares...

    Ferro (NYSE:FOE): Q4 EPS of -$0.08 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $442.6M (-17.6% Y/Y). Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • AGO

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO): Q4 EPS of $0.95 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.67. Shares...

    Assured Guaranty (NYSE:AGO): Q4 EPS of $0.95 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.67. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • VOCS

    Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS) drops 5.2% AH after posting Q4 results and announcing it's acquiring...

    Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS) drops 5.2% AH after posting Q4 results and announcing it's acquiring iContact, a provider of e-mail and social media marketing software. Vocus will pay $91M in cash, $9M in common stock, and $79M in convertible preferred stock. Interest in social media marketing software is heating up, as evidenced by Bazaarvoice's (NASDAQ:BV-OLD) IPO and recent products from CTCT and CRM. Will there be enough customer dollars to go around?

     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $18.6M (+73% Y/Y)...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $18.6M (+73% Y/Y) beats by $0.8M. Shares -6.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM

    Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $30.5M (+17.3% Y/Y) in-line....

    LSB Industries (NYSE:LXU): Q4 EPS of $1.19 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $216M (+25% Y/Y) beats by...

    LSB Industries (NYSE:LXU): Q4 EPS of $1.19 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $216M (+25% Y/Y) beats by $21M. Shares +10.4% AH. (PR)

    FARO Technologies (NASDAQ:FARO): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $77.1M (+32% Y/Y)...

    FARO Technologies (NASDAQ:FARO): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $77.1M (+32% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)

  • CPRT

    Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT): FQ2 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $228M (+9.9% Y/Y) beats by...

    Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT): FQ2 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $228M (+9.9% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) has resumed trading down 2.8% following its large Q4 miss and revenue...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) has resumed trading down 2.8% following its large Q4 miss and revenue guidance cut. The relatively modest scope of First Solar's decline demonstrates the amount of industry pessimism already baked into the shares of many solar names.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM | 17 Comments
  • MWE

    More on MarkWest Energy (NYSE:MWE): Q4 beats on revenue but trades down after hours as losses...

    More on MarkWest Energy (NYSE:MWE): Q4 beats on revenue but trades down after hours as losses widened on higher hedging losses. Revenue actually increased 11% Y/Y, as the company continues to benefit from strong exposure to the booming Marcellus shale-gas region. Shares -4.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • APEI

    American Public Education (NASDAQ:APEI): Q4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $75.7M...

    American Public Education (NASDAQ:APEI): Q4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $75.7M (+34.5% Y/Y) beats by $2.7M. Shares +6.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • VRSK

    Verisk Analytics (NASDAQ:VRSK): Q4 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $352M (+19.9% Y/Y)...

    Verisk Analytics (NASDAQ:VRSK): Q4 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $352M (+19.9% Y/Y) beats by $12M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • KOG

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 revenue grew four-fold Y/Y but still missed Street...

    More on Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 revenue grew four-fold Y/Y but still missed Street estimates, as higher interest and acquisition expenses took their toll on bottom line margins. Shares -4.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 9 Comments
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q4 EPS of $1.26 misses by $0.28. Revenue of $660M (+8% Y/Y) misses by...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q4 EPS of $1.26 misses by $0.28. Revenue of $660M (+8% Y/Y) misses by $119.9M. Company cuts 2012 revenue guidance to $3.5B-$3.8B, largely below $3.77B consensus. Reiterates 2012 EPS guidance of $3.75-$4.25, in-line with $4.14 consensus. Shares halted, will resume trading at 4:45 PM ET. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $55M (+400% Y/Y)...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $55M (+400% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • DWA

    Dreamworks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q4 EPS of $0.29 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $219M (-21% Y/Y)...

    Dreamworks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA): Q4 EPS of $0.29 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $219M (-21% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Q4 EPS of -$0.61 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $816M (+5.4% Y/Y)...

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Q4 EPS of -$0.61 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $816M (+5.4% Y/Y) beats by $35M. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • TECD

    Tech Data (TECD -5.36%) trades lower after its Q4 missed revenue estimates earlier today....

    Tech Data (TECD -5.36%) trades lower after its Q4 missed revenue estimates earlier today. Earnings fell 30% as the computer equipment and software distributor's decision to exit its operations in Brazil and Colombia weighed on bottom-line results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • HFC

    HollyFrontier (HFC -5%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4 result, beating on revenue but...

    HollyFrontier (HFC -5%) trades lower after posting a mixed Q4 result, beating on revenue but coming up short on a per share basis. Earnings soared on the refiner's increased operating scale and strong refining margins, but bottom line margins were pressured by higher production costs and merger and integration charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • ROAN

    Berry Petroleum (BRY +6.1%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $65 price target at SunTrust...

    Berry Petroleum (BRY +6.1%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $65 price target at SunTrust based on plans to increase oil production by 20% and raise overall 2012 production by 8%. Analysts also say about half of BRY's oil output is priced on the heavy California market, at a premium to West Texas Intermediate, which should boost cash flows.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM

  • Lake Shore Gold (LSG +1.3%) says a preliminary economic assessment for its Timmins West Mine...

    Lake Shore Gold (LSG +1.3%) says a preliminary economic assessment for its Timmins West Mine shows the potential for "substantial cash flow" and "attractive returns." Shares are set to start trading again at 3:10 EST after being halted pending the news announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • RDC

    Shares of Rowan Cos. (RDC -6.54%) slide despite beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings for...

    Shares of Rowan Cos. (RDC -6.54%) slide despite beating Q4 estimates earlier today. Earnings for the quarter fell 21% as the offshore drilling company reported lower contributions from discontinued operations and higher costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • PQ

    Petroquest Energy's (PQ +4%) Q4 earnings rose 16% while revenues fell 12%, but both topped Wall...

    Petroquest Energy's (PQ +4%) Q4 earnings rose 16% while revenues fell 12%, but both topped Wall Street estimates amid lower expenses for lease operating and interest, and a tax benefit. Sterne Agee believes news that PQ's JV with Next Era (NYSE:NEE) will be expedited and that development plans at La Cantera are on track will be well received by investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline's (PCLN +7%) Q4 beat and strong guidance is providing a lift to fellow online travel...

    Priceline's (PCLN +7%) Q4 beat and strong guidance is providing a lift to fellow online travel names Expedia (EXPE +1.8%) and TripAdvisor (TRIP +2.3%). However, beaten-down Orbitz (OWW -0.1%) is getting left out. (PCLN transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • ATRC

    AtriCure (ATRC +3.6%) gets a bump from an upgrade to Overweight at Piper Jaffray, citing...

    AtriCure (ATRC +3.6%) gets a bump from an upgrade to Overweight at Piper Jaffray, citing improved earnings potential after the FDA cleared its Synergy Ablation System in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM

  • Nymex crude slips 1.6% to $106.77/barrel, giving up morning gains in the past hour or so....

    Nymex crude slips 1.6% to $106.77/barrel, giving up morning gains in the past hour or so. Futures may be responding to weak U.S. economic data showing home prices continue to lag and declining durable goods orders. But some analysts say the last two trading days "have all been about profit taking by the hedge funds and banks" after oil prices topped $109 last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • JACK

    Jack in the Box's (JACK +2.1%) CFO says at an investor meeting that 80-120 restaurant units will...

    Jack in the Box's (JACK +2.1%) CFO says at an investor meeting that 80-120 restaurant units will be re-franchised in FY12 and another 70-80 in FY13. The firm expects a $0.04-$0.06 accretion to FY12 EPS as a result of the actions, with another $0.10-$0.12 added to FY13 EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • EPB

    El Paso Pipline (EPB -3.9%) trades off on the back of downgrades by three firms today, citing...

    El Paso Pipline (EPB -3.9%) trades off on the back of downgrades by three firms today, citing valuation following company's Q4 results. Raymond James cut the shares to Market Perform, while both Citigroup and JP Morgan lowered their ratings to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • KNOL

    Cable operator Knology (KNOL +7.8%) spikes after the WSJ reports the company is "shopping...

    Cable operator Knology (KNOL +7.8%) spikes after the WSJ reports the company is "shopping itself" to P-E firms and other potential buyers. Fellow regional cable operators Insight Communications and Bresnan Communications have been sold in recent years (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • NXTM

    NxStage Medical (NXTM -2.9%) drops on a downgrade to Hold from Feltl & Co. Feltl considers...

    NxStage Medical (NXTM -2.9%) drops on a downgrade to Hold from Feltl & Co. Feltl considers NxStage shares to be richly priced on an enterprise value/sales basis, given the lack of a near-term catalyst to boost adoption of its home hemiodialysis product. It's also worried competition could arrive sooner than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE +2.9%) rallies after announcing it has sold 1.2M PlayStation Vita units - up from 850K...

    Sony (SNE +2.9%) rallies after announcing it has sold 1.2M PlayStation Vita units - up from 850K as of Feb. 19, and 500K as of Jan. 10. Sony, which just launched the Vita in the U.S., also says it has sold 2M software titles for the Vita, which is expected by IDC and Strategy Analytics to post healthy sales in spite of the surging popularity of smartphone/tablet games.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • CBR

    CIBER (CBR -1.3%) drifts lower after Roth Capital removes the stock from its Focus List today on...

    CIBER (CBR -1.3%) drifts lower after Roth Capital removes the stock from its Focus List today on the back of its weaker than expected Q4 results last week. The firm also reduces its target to $5 from $6, but notes it was encouraged by the company's expectation for a rebound in H2 and maintains its Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • SWN

    Stifel Nicolaus adds to Southwestern Energy's (SWN -5.2%) pain today, cutting the shares to hold...

    Stifel Nicolaus adds to Southwestern Energy's (SWN -5.2%) pain today, cutting the shares to hold on the back of the weak Q4 and disappointing results from its test well in the Brown Dense.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SLV

    Silver continues its big 2012 run, +4% today and more than 30% YTD to $36.94/oz., a 5-month...

    Silver continues its big 2012 run, +4% today and more than 30% YTD to $36.94/oz., a 5-month high. Along with a lot of other markets, silver is thus far repeating the action of early 2011 when a winter/spring run took the metal to $50/oz., before crashing. SLV +5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • ALIM

    Shares of Alim Sciences (ALIM +68.2%) skyrocket following the news from the biopharmaceutical...

    Shares of Alim Sciences (ALIM +68.2%) skyrocket following the news from the biopharmaceutical company that it expects to have the first sustained release pharmaceutical in the EU to treat diabetic macular edema. The twittersphere is abuzz with accusations of insider trading on the stock, which at this point are a little hard to pass off as wanton conspiracy theory considering the uncanny rise in ALIM's share price yesterday and premarket today before it announced.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (COO +0.9%) gains on upbeat comments out of Wells Fargo this morning. Wells...

    Cooper Companies (COO +0.9%) gains on upbeat comments out of Wells Fargo this morning. Wells says the company is starting out the year on a positive note, with channel checks showing it taking market share and likely to beat Q1 expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • SYKE

    In spite of beating Q4 EPS estimates, Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -15.6%) is falling hard thanks to...

    In spite of beating Q4 EPS estimates, Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -15.6%) is falling hard thanks to its soft 2012 guidance. The BPO services provider, which was crushed in August following its Q2 report, says it expects Q1 revenue of $270M-$275M and EPS of $0.20-$0.23 (consensus of $300.7M and $0.30), and 2012 revenue of $1.095B-$1.11B and EPS of $1.10-$1.20 (consensus of $1.22B and $1.44). Sykes blames macro issues and an assortment of margin pressures.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.1%) spikes higher on volume 3X normal trading activity after...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.1%) spikes higher on volume 3X normal trading activity after Auriga upgrades it to a Buy rating with a $54 price target. Analysts call the firm's 2012 guidance conservative and indicate that they see a high likelihood that Salix will outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • USG

    Building materials provider USG (USG +4.1%) jumps following an upgrade to Overweight from...

    Building materials provider USG (USG +4.1%) jumps following an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, The firm, which is also lifting its PT to $18.50, says a recent check indicates customers have largely accepted a recent 35% price hike for USG's gypsum wallboard products, and that the hike will boost the company's bottom line and strengthen its balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • VVUS

    Though a 7.7% falloff in shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) isn't cause for alarm after they ran up...

    Though a 7.7% falloff in shares of Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) isn't cause for alarm after they ran up 83% over the last 5 trading sessions, Forbes is out with a cautionary take on the company's new obesity drug that is all the rage. "It seems intuitively obvious that the market for an obesity drug would be vast. But the reality is that obesity drugs have never sold in Lipitor-like numbers."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • RAIL

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL +5.1%) post a tidy gain after Zacks lines up the railroad car...

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL +5.1%) post a tidy gain after Zacks lines up the railroad car manufacturer with a #1 Rank (Strong Buy). Analysts point to the 4,481 units that were ordered last quarter, pushing its backlog up 304% Y/Y to 8,303 units.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • TGP

    Teekay LNG (TGP -2.5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform on...

    Teekay LNG (TGP -2.5%) trades lower after being downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform on valuation at Wells Fargo. The stock has been supercharged over the past few months, gaining over 28% since late November.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.3%) shares surge after Q4 results topped expectations and sales...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP +7.3%) shares surge after Q4 results topped expectations and sales of its Xifaxan gastrointestinal drug picked up significantly during H2 2011. SLXP also guides to at least 25% organic growth in Xifaxan in 2012, with strong growth in January that beat the prior record month of December.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • ERT

    eResearch Technology (ERT +16.9%) shares soar after Q4 results beat analyst estimates and...

    eResearch Technology (ERT +16.9%) shares soar after Q4 results beat analyst estimates and Benchmark says it believes underlying clinical research industry trends recovered late in 2011 and have now returned to a favorable track. In raising shares to Buy, the firm expects improved margins, profitability and cash flow with the recent release of the Expert3 platform.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • ENOC

    Shares of EnerNOC (ENOC -7.8%) dip after Q4 reporting a wider Y/Y EPS loss and revenue results...

    Shares of EnerNOC (ENOC -7.8%) dip after Q4 reporting a wider Y/Y EPS loss and revenue results that miss estimates. The company also issues Q1 guidance at the low end of revenue estimates, now expecting to earn between $240M - $280M versus Street estimates of $267M. Needham cuts the shares to hold on the back of the weak results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy's (SWN -5.1%) Q4 earnings rose 6% as the energy producer benefited from...

    Southwestern Energy's (SWN -5.1%) Q4 earnings rose 6% as the energy producer benefited from higher production and strength in its midstream business, but shares are lower as the company also lowers full-year production expectations and trims capital spending plans. “The miss was on realized prices,” CapitalOne Southcoast says, adding that tests of SWN’s Brown Dense wells were “inconclusive.”

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • AMRS

    Biofuel producer Amyris (AMRS -8.9%) takes a hit this morning after missing its Q4 estimates on...

    Biofuel producer Amyris (AMRS -8.9%) takes a hit this morning after missing its Q4 estimates on all counts late yesterday. Losses increased on a per share basis, despite a 39% Y/Y jump in overall revenue, as materials and fermentation costs take a toll on bottom line margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • APOL

    Shares of for-profit educators are hammered after Apollo (APOL -12%) lowers estimates for Q2...

    Shares of for-profit educators are hammered after Apollo (APOL -12%) lowers estimates for Q2 enrollment and operating profit range. CECO -10.2%, EDMC -6%, ESI-OLD -5.8%, LOPE -3.9%, APEI -2.9%, DV -2.7%, CPLA -2.2%, COCO -1.2%, STRA -1%,LINC -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC +1.2%) and Micron (MU +4.6%) will expand their NAND Flash memory JV relationship to...

    Intel (INTC +1.2%) and Micron (MU +4.6%) will expand their NAND Flash memory JV relationship to improve the venture's efficiency and flexibility; Micron will supply NAND products to Intel while Intel will sell its stake in two wafer factories for ~$600M. The chipmakers also will extend their NAND development program, expanding it to include emerging memory technologies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • CHMT

    Shares of Chemtura (CHMT +8.6%) show strength coming off of the firm's Q4 earnings beat. The...

    Shares of Chemtura (CHMT +8.6%) show strength coming off of the firm's Q4 earnings beat. The chemicals manufacturer provides an upbeat outlook for 2012, saying that it expects industrial output to recover in the summer and then build momentum in the last half of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • TCPTF

    TD Securities weighs in on Thompson Creek Metals (TC -12.5%) weak Q4 report, cutting its rating...

    TD Securities weighs in on Thompson Creek Metals (TC -12.5%) weak Q4 report, cutting its rating to Hold after the company revises guidance to reflect higher capex estimates at its Endako and Mount Milligan projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • YRCW

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW -12%) are getting hammered today after Q4 EPS losses came in much...

    Shares of YRC Worldwide (YRCW -12%) are getting hammered today after Q4 EPS losses came in much wider than expected, as expenses continue to outpace revenue growth at the struggling company. The trucker, saddled with debt, has been fending off a bankruptcy protection filing since late 2009.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • DPZ

    Although it's not an ETF fund an investor can buy quite yet, a mock "fat guy" fund of companies...

    Although it's not an ETF fund an investor can buy quite yet, a mock "fat guy" fund of companies selling beer, pizza, burritos, and chicken wings is racking up an impressive 6-month return. Holdings: DPZ +38.4%, CMG +30.2%, BWLD +45.8%, FMX +14.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 5 Comments
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN +7.7%) is the S&P's top percentage gainer, as its strong Q4 report pushes...

    Priceline (PCLN +7.7%) is the S&P's top percentage gainer, as its strong Q4 report pushes shares to all-time highs. Adjusted EPS of $5.37 on revenue of $990.8M whipped analyst consensus $5.06 and $969.3M. Total bookings rose 51.8% Y/Y, reaching $4.96B, solid results in the face of challenging macro conditions in Europe. Goldman, Citi and Jefferies all raise price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ +9.1%) zooms higher after the company knocks out a Q4 earnings beat and...

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ +9.1%) zooms higher after the company knocks out a Q4 earnings beat and increases its outlook for global retail sales to a range of 5%-8% - from its previous guidance of 4%-7%. Shares hit an all-time high of $37.70 in early trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • SINA

    Down yesterday after posting so-so Q4 results and providing soft Q1 guidance, Sina (SINA +10.8%)...

    Down yesterday after posting so-so Q4 results and providing soft Q1 guidance, Sina (SINA +10.8%) is now up sharply. With shares down 57% from their 52-week high going into earnings, thanks to regulatory concerns about Weibo, Sina's earnings call remarks about the impact of regulations on sign-ups may be better than some feared. SA's Jiang Zhang considers it unlikely Weibo will be shut down, given its government support.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • ODP

    Office supply retailers pace sector gainers after Office Depot (ODP +12.9%) reported...

    Office supply retailers pace sector gainers after Office Depot (ODP +12.9%) reported better-than-expected Q4 earnings. Smaller rival OfficeMax's (OMX +1.2%) results last week also topped Wall Street expectations, and both results give a positive signal ahead of industry leader Staples' (SPLS +2.8%) results on Wednesday. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • TRAK

    Shares of DealerTrack (TRAK -5.9%) tail off after the company announces a $150M offering of...

    Shares of DealerTrack (TRAK -5.9%) tail off after the company announces a $150M offering of senior convertible notes. The company says that it expects to use a portion of the net proceeds from the offering to fund the cost of convertible note hedge transactions.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
